info.name: Laravel AI Engine - Complete API Collection
info.description:
Complete API collection for Laravel AI Engine including Chat, RAG, Smart Actions, Federated Search, Node Management, Vector Operations, and Module Discovery.

## Features
- ü§ñ Multi-engine AI Chat (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini)
- üìö RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
- üéØ Smart Actions with AI Parameter Extraction
- ‚úâÔ∏è AI-Generated Email Drafts
- üìÖ Calendar Event Creation (ICS + Google Calendar)
- üîç Vector Search & Semantic Similarity
- üåê Federated Node Architecture
- üì¶ Dynamic Model Registry
- üîÑ Real-time Streaming

## Smart Actions
Execute AI-powered actions with automatic parameter extraction:
- `email.reply` - AI-generated email drafts
- `calendar.create` - Calendar events with ICS data
- `ai.summarize` - Content summarization
- `ai.translate` - Content translation
- `source.view` - View source documents

## Authentication
Most endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Set your `api_token` in the environment variables.

## Getting Started
1. Import this collection and the environment file
2. Set your `base_url` and `api_token`
3. Start with the Health Check endpoint to verify connectivity
4. Try the Smart Actions folder for AI-powered features

exec: // Auto-generate session ID if not set
// Global test: Check for valid JSON

item.name: Chat APIs

body.raw:
{
    "message": "Hello! How are you?",
    "session_id": "{{session_id}}",
    "engine": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o",
    "memory": true,
    "actions": true,
    "use_intelligent_rag": true,
    "rag_collections": []
}

request.description:
Send a chat message with optional RAG and memory.

**Parameters:**
- `message` (required): The message to send
- `session_id` (required): Unique session identifier
- `engine`: AI engine (openai, anthropic, gemini)
- `model`: Model to use (gpt-4o, claude-3-5-sonnet, etc.)
- `memory`: Enable conversation memory
- `actions`: Enable suggested actions
- `use_intelligent_rag`: Enable RAG context retrieval
- `rag_collections`: Array of model classes to search

response.name: Success Response
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "response": "Hello! I'm doing well, thank you for asking. How can I assist you today?",
    "actions": [],
    "usage": {
        "prompt_tokens": 15,
        "completion_tokens": 20,
        "total_tokens": 35
    },
    "session_id": "user-123-session",
    "rag_enabled": false,
    "context_count": 0,
    "sources": []
}

query.description: Maximum number of messages to return

request.description:
Get conversation history for a session.

**Parameters:**
- `session_id` (path): Session identifier
- `limit` (query): Maximum messages to return (default: 50)

response.name: Success Response

request.description: Clear conversation history for a session.

formdata.description: File type: image, document, audio, video

request.description:
Upload a file for AI processing.

**Supported Types:**
- Images: jpg, png, gif, webp
- Documents: pdf, doc, docx, txt
- Audio: mp3, wav, m4a

Get list of available AI engines and their models.

**Data Sources:**
- **Database**: Models from Dynamic Model Registry (`ai_models` table)
- **Pre-defined**: Built-in engine configurations from `EngineEnum`

The response merges models from both sources, with database models taking precedence for pricing and capability information.

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Get list of available dynamic actions.

**Parameters:**
- `query` (optional): Filter actions by relevance to query

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Execute a dynamic action.

**Parameters:**
- `action` (required): Action ID to execute
- `parameters` (required): Action parameters
- `session_id` (required): Session identifier

response.name: Success Response

request.description: Get memory statistics for a session including token counts and message breakdown.
Get a summary of conversation context and discussed topics.

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Get authenticated user's conversation list with pagination.

**Requires Authentication**

response.name: Success Response

item.description: Chat API endpoints for conversational AI with memory, actions, and file uploads.

item.name: RAG APIs

body.raw:
{
    "message": "What posts do you have about Laravel?",
    "session_id": "{{session_id}}",
    "engine": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o",
    "memory": true,
    "actions": true,
    "use_intelligent_rag": true,
    "rag_collections": ["App\\Models\\Post"]
}

request.description:
Send a message with RAG context retrieval.

**Parameters:**
- `message` (required): The message to send
- `session_id` (required): Unique session identifier
- `engine`: AI engine (openai, anthropic, gemini)
- `model`: Model to use
- `memory`: Enable conversation memory
- `actions`: Enable suggested actions
- `use_intelligent_rag`: Enable intelligent RAG
- `rag_collections`: Array of model classes to search

response.name: Success Response

request.description: Get available RAG collections (Vectorizable models).
Get available AI engines for RAG.
Check RAG system health status.
Clear RAG conversation history.
Get RAG conversation history.

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Execute a RAG action (e.g., view source, follow-up question).

**Parameters:**
- `action_id` (required): Action identifier
- `action_type` (required): Type (button, quick_reply)
- `payload` (required): Action data

Get authenticated user's RAG conversations with pagination.

**Requires Authentication**

item.description: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) API endpoints for semantic search and context-aware AI responses.

item.name: Node APIs (Federated)

request.description: Get health status of a node. This is a public endpoint.
Get available Vectorizable collections from a node. This is a public endpoint.

Register a new node in the federated network.

**Parameters:**
- `name` (required): Node name
- `url` (required): Node URL
- `capabilities`: Array of capabilities
- `metadata`: Additional metadata
- `version`: Node version

Search collections on a node using vector similarity.

**Requires Node Authentication**

**Parameters:**
- `query` (required): Search query
- `limit`: Maximum results
- `options.collections`: Collections to search
- `options.threshold`: Similarity threshold

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Execute an action on a node.

**Requires Node Authentication**

**Actions:**
- `index`: Index models for vector search
- `delete`: Delete indexed vectors
- `update`: Update indexed vectors
- `sync`: Synchronize vectors

Get detailed status of a registered node.

**Requires Node Authentication**

Refresh the node's access token using a refresh token.

**Requires Node Authentication**

item.description: Federated node API endpoints for distributed RAG architecture. Nodes can register, authenticate, and perform searches across the network.

item.name: Vector Search APIs

request.description:
Search vectors for semantic similarity.

**Parameters:**
- `query` (required): Search query
- `model_class` (required): Model class to search
- `limit`: Maximum results (default: 10)
- `threshold`: Similarity threshold (default: 0.3)

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Index a model for vector search.

**Parameters:**
- `model_class` (required): Model class to index
- `batch_size`: Number of records per batch (default: 100)

query.description: Model class to check status for

request.description: Get indexing status for a model.
Get vector search analytics and statistics.

item.description: Vector search and embedding APIs for semantic similarity search.

item.name: Model Registry APIs

request.description:
Get list of available AI models from the Dynamic Model Registry.

**Query Parameters:**
- `provider`: Filter by provider
- `capability`: Filter by capability
- `active`: Filter active models only
Get detailed information about a specific AI model.

response.name: Success Response
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "model": {
        "id": 1,
        "provider": "openai",
        "model_id": "gpt-4o",
        "display_name": "GPT-4o",
        "description": "Most capable GPT-4 model with vision",
        "capabilities": ["text", "vision", "function_calling"],
        "context_window": 128000,
        "max_output_tokens": 16384,
        "pricing": {
            "input_per_1k": 0.005,
            "output_per_1k": 0.015
        },
        "version": "2024-11-20",
        "is_active": true,
        "is_deprecated": false,
        "deprecation_date": null
    }
}

request.description:
Get recommended model for a specific task.

**Parameters:**
- `task`: Task type (code_generation, chat, analysis, etc.)
- `provider`: Preferred provider
- `max_cost`: Maximum cost per 1K tokens
- `required_capabilities`: Required capabilities

response.name: Success Response

request.description:
Sync models from a provider's API to discover new models.

**Parameters:**
- `provider`: Provider to sync (openai, anthropic, etc.)

item.description: Dynamic Model Registry APIs for managing AI models. Supports auto-discovery of new models like GPT-5, GPT-6, Claude 4, etc.

item.name: Module Discovery APIs

request.description: Discover available modules and their capabilities in the AI Engine.

response.name: Success Response

item.description: Module discovery APIs for exploring available AI Engine capabilities.

item.name: Streaming APIs

body.raw:
{
    "message": "Write a detailed explanation of Laravel routing",
    "session_id": "{{session_id}}",
    "engine": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o",
    "stream": true,
    "memory": true,
    "use_intelligent_rag": true
}

request.description:
Stream chat responses using Server-Sent Events (SSE).

**Note:** This endpoint returns a stream of events. Use a client that supports SSE.

**Parameters:**
- `message` (required): The message to send
- `session_id` (required): Session identifier
- `stream`: Must be true
- `engine`: AI engine to use
- `model`: Model to use

response.name: Stream Response

item.description: Streaming API endpoints for real-time AI responses using Server-Sent Events.

item.name: Smart Actions

request.description:
Execute any action. Supports local and remote execution.

**Parameters:**
- `action_type` (required): Type of action to execute
- `data` (required): Action data including params
- `session_id`: Session identifier

**Action Types:**
- `view_source`: View source document
- `find_similar`: Find similar content
- `draft_reply`: Draft email reply
- `regenerate`: Regenerate response
- `copy`: Copy content

response.name: View Source Success

request.description:
Execute email reply action with AI-generated draft.

**Smart Executor:** `email.reply`

**Parameters:**
- `to_email`: Recipient email address
- `subject`: Email subject
- `original_content`: Original email content for context

**Returns:**
- AI-generated professional reply draft
- Ready-to-send status

response.name: Email Reply Success

request.description:
Create a calendar event with ICS data and Google Calendar URL.

**Smart Executor:** `calendar.create`

**Parameters:**
- `title` (required): Event title
- `date`: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- `time`: Time in HH:MM format
- `duration`: Duration in minutes
- `location`: Event location
- `attendees`: Array of attendee emails

**Returns:**
- ICS calendar data (downloadable)
- Google Calendar URL (one-click add)

response.name: Calendar Event Success

request.description:
Summarize content using AI.

**Smart Executor:** `ai.summarize`

**Parameters:**
- `content` (required): Content to summarize
- `max_length`: Maximum summary length in characters

response.name: Summarize Success

request.description:
Translate content using AI.

**Smart Executor:** `ai.translate`

**Parameters:**
- `content` (required): Content to translate
- `target_language`: Target language (default: English)

Select a numbered option from AI response.

**Parameters:**
- `option_number` (required): The option number to select
- `session_id` (required): Session identifier
- `source_index`: Index in sources array
- `sources`: Array of source documents

query.description: Context for filtering actions (email, calendar, task)

request.description:
Get available actions for a context.

**Query Parameters:**
- `context`: Filter actions by context (email, calendar, task)
- `include_remote`: Include actions from federated nodes

response.name: Available Actions

request.description:
Execute an action on a specific remote node.

**Parameters:**
- `node` (required): Target node slug
- `action_type` (required): Type of action
- `data` (required): Action data
- `session_id`: Session identifier

Execute an action on all federated nodes.

**Parameters:**
- `action_type` (required): Type of action
- `data` (required): Action data
- `parallel`: Execute in parallel (default: true)
- `node_ids`: Filter to specific nodes (null = all)

item.description:
Smart Action System with AI-powered parameter extraction, federated execution, and built-in executors for email, calendar, tasks, and more.

## Features
- ü§ñ AI Parameter Extraction
- ‚úâÔ∏è Email Reply Drafts
- üìÖ Calendar Event Creation
- ‚úÖ Task Creation
- üìù AI Summarize & Translate
- üåê Federated Execution

## Executors
- `email.reply` - AI-generated email drafts
- `email.forward` - Forward emails
- `calendar.create` - Create calendar events with ICS
- `task.create` - Create tasks
- `ai.summarize` - Summarize content
- `ai.translate` - Translate content
- `source.view` - View source documents
- `source.find_similar` - Find similar content

item.name: Health & Status

request.description: Get overall system health status. Use this to verify connectivity.
Get status of all AI engines including availability and configuration.

response.name: Success Response

item.description: Health check and status endpoints for monitoring the AI Engine.

variable.description: Base URL of your Laravel application
URL of a child node in the federated network
JWT token for node authentication (obtained from Register Node)
AI model ID for model registry queries
